TextView.android:text: Instruction for use: • Patient Info Activity: o In the Patient info activity add/edit information about the patient and all of the data is saved appropriately in Simple DB . • Vital Stats Activity: o This activity displays the results in both tabular and graphical format. On selecting the “Line Graph” tab at the top. This will display the results in graphical format. Clicking on one of the points on the graph, for the selected point, the toast should display a date and the result. The date and corresponding result should match the result in the tabular view. • Health Calculator Activity: o that the speedometer activity is showing the results for the selected health risk. When the health risk selection changes in the drop down menu, the title at the top should also change. For example, if the selected health risk is “Vascular Disease”, the title shows “Health Risk for Vascular Disease” • New Test Activity – o the picture can be taken using the mobile device’s camera by clicking “New Test”. On next screen, choose “Cholesterol”. Take the picture using the camera icon button at the bottom. Click on the camera icon button at the bottom to take a picture. The user should be able to take a picture. that the correct coordinates of the image are provided in the program. Click “New Test”. On next screen, choose “Cholesterol”. Take the picture using the camera icon button at the bottom. Select a small area on the top left corner of the image. The toast should show coordinates close to (0,0). that the correct RGB value is being calculated for the selected region. For this test case, we are using Logs inside the Java/Android code and running the app in debug mode. Log In. Choose “New Test”. Select “Cholestrol”. Click on cameron icon to take a picture. (In this case a picture of a sample). Select an area of the image. Press the button with Calculator icon to calculate the cholesterol value. The Log for RGB value on Android should show values R, G, and B. All 3 values for RGB should be close together. There are some lightning effects so the values will not be accurate. • Calibration Activity: o the picture can be taken using the mobile device’s camera by clicking “Take image”. On next screen, choose “Next”. Take the picture using the camera icon button at the bottom. Click on the camera icon button at the bottom to take a picture. The user should be able to take a picture. That the correct coordinates of the image are provided in the program. Click “Finished”. On next screen, choose “square”. Click next and take as many images. Click finish to see the table of test values. Click on graph to see the line of best fit. • Communications : o After clicking on the communications icon on home page you see options to email and text and both email and text work as expected.
